description: Cholera is an acute diarrheal disease caused by the Gram-negative, facultative aerobe, bacterium V. cholerae. It is a member of the Vibrionaceae family and is classified into more than 200 serogroups based on the lipopolysaccharide O antigen, but only serotypes O1 and 0139 cause disease in humans.
name: Vibrio cholerae Antibodies and Antigens
